221501.name: Bushido: Kioshi Makoto
221501.description:
“Like all the cycles of the world, those within the Golden Empire are no different. From the changing of the cycles to the rise and fall of the great clans that rule, so is the way things are, and so is the way they will remain for they are as constant as rock and as inevitable as the stream that finds the ocean.” Common Subarashi Baransu saying.

All the great clans draw on the lesser clans for support, either on the battlefield, in court or commercially, the Takashi are no different and for many generations the Makoto have enjoyed the protection of the Takashi in exchange for their wisdom and consort. The Makoto family are renowned for their wealth of knowledge and love of the sciences. Kioshi has long been the voice of reason in the court of Ryu, his quiet words hold more weight than Minimoto steel to the heads of the Takashi.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.

221502.name: The Smuggler's Caves
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
221502.description:
From publisher blurb:

A treasure map for sale, and stories of a lost treasure hidden in a cave system, this adventure has physical danger, dangerous creatures and humans who are not understanding.A good adventure for a new but experienced player.

221503.name: The Stairway
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
221503.description:
From publisher blurb:

A mysterious starirway raising up out of the ocean leads to ancient wealth and artifacts or perhaps death at the hand of hostile Duarf, who don't like the graves of their ancient dead being violated.

221504.name: Bushido: Takashi, Ancestor Spirit
221504.description:
Those that follow the way of Michi will often spend hours in meditation, waiting for a sign from their ancestors of the correct path they should follow or the right choice to make. In times of peril the ancestor spirits have been known to manifest in physical form. Their presence guiding the hands, minds and blades of the living, gifting them their infinite insight and knowledge gathered from their timeless vigil and granting them the courage to stay on the path. Of course this comes at a great price to the spirit for once you have left the heavens you may never return…

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.

221505.name: Bushido: Goshi
221505.description:
From Ugo to Eddo, the loyal servants of the Takashi can be called upon to bolster the ranks of the Dragon’s armies. Their knowledge of the terrain invaluable in giving the Prefecture an added advantage in battle.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.

221506.name: Bushido: Atsushi and Shinobu
221506.description:
The ronin of the Shiho remain a thorn in the Takashis' side. Without a fixed army the Takashi have found it almost impossible to hunt down and destroy the remaining rebels in the field, these cowed dogs hide in the woods and hills of the Dragon's lands. The solution has been somewhat answered in the excellent tracking and scouting skills of Atsushi, a former Satou family retainer now sworn to the Takashi. With his faithful hound Shinobu, rooting out those hiding in the dark, eager to savage any at the utterance of a single word from his master.

Blister contains two models, two 30mm bases and two full colour profile cards.

221507.name: Bushido: Lady Oka
221507.description:
Lady Oka is as deadly as she is beautiful. Raised in the luxury of Ryu she is a great power in the court and has learned to use the weapons gifted to her just as expertly as those crafted of polished steel and lacquered wooded in the dojo. A nimble and dexterous warrior she wields the traditional weapon of a lady of the samurai caste, with a natural ease and elegance. She moves across the battlefield with the poise and grace of a dancer, avoiding blows and missiles as if they were not even there.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.

221508.name: Bushido: Takashi Houseguard
221508.description:
All lords maintain a healthy number of household guards, training warriors to keep them safe from their enemies. The Takashi guard’s body may not be as honed as that of the Ashigaru who constantly train and drill. This does not mean that their eyes are not sharp as blades and their ears keen as hawks, skills developed over the years watching for threats to their lords and ladies.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.

221509.name: Bushido: Takashi Retainer
221509.description:
Samurai culture has both military and feudal culture. Everyone fits into the social pyramid where a leader had his trusted supporters under his command. They in turn had their own respective supporters under their command, and so on and so on. The Takashi retainers are all capable warriors in the service of a Takashi Samurai of a higher rank, willing to lay down their lives in service. A high ranking lord will always have at least a hand full of retainers watching and guarding them at all times, constantly scanning a crowd or appraising a seemingly harmless peasant seeking council.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.

221510.name: Bushido: Bachiko Takashi
221510.description:
Bachiko is as loyal and devoted to her lord as any can claim to be. She lives and breathes to protect the Takashi line as her father and his father before. A masterful swordswoman, hours spent in the service has given her a sixth sense for danger and she alone has foiled many cowardly attacks against her masters.

This model can be used as a unique profile or as the second model for the Takashi Retainer Profile card.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.

221511.name: Trappist-1
221511.description:
In Trappist-1, your goal is to have five cards worth the most points at the end of the game. To do this, you will bid Trappist-1 cards against opponents to trigger special abilities, trade your bids with the Ascending Market, and build your hand in concert with the Retrograde Stacks. Once the deck runs out, the game ends and the player with the best hand of five wins!

Setup
1. Shuffle the deck and deal four cards to each player.
2. Reveal four cards and place them in a line. This is the Ascending Market.
We are ready to play!

Gameplay
1. Players simultaneously bid one card. Their goal is to match their card to the neighboring planet(s) in the Ascending Market. For example, Trappist-1c cards only trade for Trappist-1b cards and Trappist-1d cards.
2. Reveal the bid. If any player’s bids match, those cards are returned to the respective player’s hand and those players will not trade this round. The first player in Trade Order may now use the card’s ability. The Trade Order is determined by the Retrograde Stack. At the beginning of the game, the Trade Order defaults to alphabetical order (b-h), but as the game progresses, the Retrograde Stack will determine the hierarchy of cards.
3. Now, in Trade Order, players put their bid card into the Ascending Market and simultaneously pull out neighboring planet cards. For example, if a player’s bid card is Trappist-1d, that player puts their Trappist-1d card into the Ascending Market and takes into their hand any Trappist-1c or Trappist-1e cards from the Ascending Market. The Trappist-1d card left in the Ascending Market is now available to other players.
4. Once all players have traded with the Ascending Market, the Ascending Market shifts right to the Retrograde Stack in order from closest to the stack to farthest. As new cards enter the Retrograde Stack, give them a new row on the farthest right column.

End Game & Scoring

Play continues until the deck cannot replenish four cards in the Ascending Market. Players now pick the best five cards in their hand for point tallying. Points are awarded by multiplying the card in your hand with the number of matching planets in the Retrograde Stack. For example, if there are five Venus cards in the Retrograde Stack and two Venus cards in your hand at the end of the game, you score 10 points for those two cards. Extra cards in players’ hands are ignored.

The player with the most points wins!

221512.name: Bushido: Takashi Samurai
221512.description:
From childhood, the Samurai train to have self-discipline and a sense of duty, together with contempt for material goods, fear, pain and especially death. When combined with an unshakable devotion to their clan and lord they are the epitome of those who truly follow Michi.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.

221513.name: Galaxy Rise
221513.description:
Hidden identities with opposing goals compete for trick-taking galaxy supremacy!

Players are given hidden identity cards: The "Envoy" scores points for other people making their bid, the "Saboteur" scores for others failing, and everybody else scores for making their own. The deck size changes depending on the player count (3, 4, or 5) so every game is balanced.

After being dealt their hands and hidden identities, each player bids the number of tricks they will take using gems. Color-coded gems make it easy to see if the bid is under, full, or over. One player may be a saboteur, so you cannot count on every bid being legitimate.

The hand is played out in trick. The Solar suit is always trump. As players take tricks they place their gems on the piles so the status of all bids is apparent to all. After the last trick is taken every player reveals their identity and scores points accordingly. Players move their corresponding cube on the score track until one player makes it to 30 points to win the game.

STORY

Centuries of multilateral conflicts throughout the galaxy are being resolved at the diplomatic conference of the era: The Congress of Zienna. Borderlines will be drawn and the resources of entire systems will be acquired. Empires, alliances, and multi-planetery corporations struggle for power --- not in battle but at the negotiating table.

You are a representative of a galactic power sent to Zienna Prime. Your goal at the negotiating table depends on your hidden identity:

Envoy - Galactic peace alliances benefit from stability and mutual success. The Envoy's goal is to help all parties get what they want.

Saboteur - Hired by nefarious provocateurs seeking conflict, the saboteur is sent to prevent the negotiations from being a success.

Solo Agent - Representing the interests of a single client state or corporation, agents work to maximise acquisitions with no regard for competitors.

221514.name: Bushido: Iiju Makoto
221514.description:
A ward is a member of a noble clan who has been taken in by another clan to be raised for a time. The practice varies, with it sometimes being undertaken voluntarily - to help prospective heirs learn the customs of other clans as part of their education. It can also be involuntarily, with the "ward" actually being a "hostage" for his or her clan's good behaviour or until a ransom is paid. Sometimes, as part of marriage alliances, one of the betrothed is taken as a ward so he or she can get to know his or her future spouse. IIju is not Dragon but Hare, although his loyalty to the Takashi is unquestioned, he is the head of the Takashi household guard whom follow his orders without hesitation.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.

221515.name: Bushido: Kenta Takashi
221515.description:
Kenta is a true samurai in every sense of the word. As a boy he knew his path, the one he has walked for many cycles in service to his family and the name Takashi. A veteran of countless battles and campaigns, he is a master swordsman, no foe able to outflank him due to practised footwork and deft movements. Many times enemies foolishly thought they had struck the killing blow but the ancestors favour Kenta amongst all others. Though quietly spoken his presence in battle banishes any fear in his troops, steeling their hearts for victory.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.

221516.name: Precursors
221516.description:
The Precursors is the first-person RPG/Action Elite-style game with innovative gameplay.

The game has been released in ex-USSR on 6th of December of 2009.

The game takes place on several planets and you as a young pilot are able to fly from one planet to another.
There are over 350 missions in the game.

Source: The Developer Website.

221517.name: APOCalypse 2500 GM's Campaign Guide & Bestiary
221517.description:
From publisher blurb:

This GM's Campaign Guide & Bestiary contains essential tools for the game master, from reference tables to monsters. The game master's tools provide game mechanics quick reference, optional rules applications, and random generation of game elements such as weather, moon phase, and storm affects for adventures on paper or on the fly. The various NPC's, locations, and monsters are fully specked out in easy to read table format for instant game use. Many new possibilities for player characters, both species and vocation, are added and fully annotated in the bestiary section for easy use in character creation.

221518.name: APOCalypse 2500 Magic & Techno-Sorcery (Second Edition)
221518.description:
From publisher blurb:

APOCalypse 2500 Magic & Techno-Sorcery is the first volume of magic and techno-magic designed for the game Universe of APOCalypse 2500. This second edition, covers the theory and practice of magic in the game universe in more detail and contains theory spells devices potions weapons vehicles and rules augmentation. Game masters will find this book an invaluable tool in their many campaigns and a good source of magical treasure. Licensed Product Producers will find this book an invaluable tool when adding magic to their adventure scenarios.

221519.name: The Zombie Plagues Expanded Edition
221519.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book goes into great depth as to the behavior of both zombies and the plague as well as how it mutates and what it really is. This book is far more than a single monster reference as it creates a complete resource and new reality within the world of APOCalypse 2500. Both GM's and Compatible Product Producers will find this book indispensable when creating and running zombie adventures. Included in this volume, is a complete zombie adventure scenario set in an abandon walled city, lost to the plague centuries ago.

221520.name: Grappledrome
221520.description:
Grappledrome is a tense, fast-paced multiplayer arena shooter built around a grappling/swinging movement mechanic - it's Unreal Tournament meets Bionic Commando. Soar through the map looking for the ideal weapon pickup before ambushing your victim from on high. Make spectacular escapes, swing past obstacles and find new angles to re-engage your enemy. Delight the Overlord as you kill each other for all eternity!

Source: The Game Website.

221521.name: Apocalypse 2500 Magic & Techno-Sorcery
221521.description:
From publisher blurb:

Apocalypse 2500 Magic & Techno-Sorcery is the first volume of magic and techno-magic designed for the game Universe of Apocalypse 2500. This volume covers the theory and practice of magic in the game universe in more detail and contains lists of new spells, potions, and devices for the Sorcerer and Techno-Mage alike. Game masters will find this reference book an invaluable tool in their many campaigns and a good source for magical treasure. The basic principles set forth in Magic & Techno-Sorcery allow Gm's to create an endless variety of new spells, potions, and devices for their custom game scenarios.

221522.name: Gylden Kongerike: Golden Kingdom of the Dwarves
221522.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Dwarf kingdom of Gylden Kongerike is the southernmost region of the fortress mountains and is considered the gateway to the many lands beyond. Unlike the dwarves you know the ones here at the Golden Kingdom have built an above ground village and trading center inhabited by many arcane, dwarf, and humans side by side in a setting reminiscent of a medieval town studded with seeming anachronistic technology. Game Masters this is an excellent quest all on its own with its dangerous labyrinths, adventures into fairy infested forests, dangerous mountain passes, and a lively town setting. Or it can be used as a resting place or starting spot for a much broader campaign as the village of Gylden Kongerike has every resource player characters might need to begin a new adventure. This little dwarf village is a great place for new characters to "cut their teeth" and gain a little treasure in the process.

221523.name: Alcatraz
221523.description:
From publisher blurb:

Alcatraz has been many things but in the last hundreds of years. It has been the home to fantastic experiments, exquisite magic and horrible monsters. Now is the time to explore this fantastic and old island prison. Find treasure and discover the secrets of the zombie outbreaks.

221524.name: Shu
221524.description:
Shu is a beautiful and engrossing platformer that we’re bringing to PC and consoles with our friends at Secret Lunch.

Control Shu and a colourful trail of hand-drawn characters as they run, jump and glide their way up an ancient mountain, forever pursued by a monstrous and unrelenting storm.

Can you outrun the end of the world?

Source: The Developer Website.

221525.name: Blindes Huhn extrem: Tauschen
221525.description:
Blindes Huhn extrem: Tauschen is a promotional card for Blindes Huhn extrem that allows you to change your hand with another player.

Designer Michael Schacht released Blindes Huhn extrem: Tauschen as one-half of a postcard Christmas card (the other half containing Maharaja: Reichtum).

221526.name: Z-LAND Corebook
221526.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Extreme Survival Horror

Publisher's blurb:

This is Z-Land where humanity is no longer the top of the food chain, where every day could be your last. Hunger, Thirst, Sleep and Exposure all wear down on you in a battle of attrition with the unstoppable Dead. Find the answer to the question "just how long would I survive" as you and your friends attempt to do just that. What makes Z-Land unique is we take the survival aspect of survival-horror very seriously. You will see your character weaken as sleep deprivation, hunger & thirst slowly whittle them down. But that is where the choice comes in, will you just take it? Or will you do anything & everything necessary to survive? How much of yourself can you retain in your battle to survive?

221527.name: Das Vermächtnis des Maharaja: Reichtum
221527.description:
Das Vermächtnis des Maharaja: Reichtum is a promotional card for Das Vermächtnis des Maharaja that gets you eight rupees for any 2 antiques cards.
Released as one-half of a postcard, the other half being Blindes Huhn extrem: Tauschen.

221528.name: Companions' Tale
221528.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




From the introduction:

Companions’ Tale is a map-making storytelling game where you tell the tale of an epic hero, righting wrongs and saving kingdoms. The hero acts, and leaves others to tell the tale. You are those others: the hero's closest companions. Whose version of the heroic tale will become canon, and whose will be a footnote to history?

221529.name: Mutant: Mechatron
221529.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Rise of the Robots

Publisher's blurb:

In the huge underwater Mechatron-7 facility, armies of machines toil away in decaying factories. When the war raged the humans fled, leaving their robotic servants with one simple command: continue the production until we return. That was decades ago. Now, something is changing. Robots in Mechatron-7 are starting to malfunction. To rebel. To express a will of their own. To Awake. It's time for the machines to make their mark on the dawnworld.

221530.name: Zone Compendium: Eternal War
221530.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

[Copiled] Zone Sectors...in a single, full-color volume.

221531.name: LexOccultum: Lex Libris
221531.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Occultism and Secret Societies in the 18th Century

Publisher's blurb:

Lex Libris is the core rules for the Game Master to run the game.

221532.name: LexOccultum: Alter Ego
221532.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Occultism and Secret Societies in the 18th Century

Publisher's blurb:

Alter Ego is the book dedicated for the players.

221533.name: LexOccultum: Roi-de-Rats
221533.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Occultism and Secret Societies in the 18th Century

Publisher's blurb:

Roi-de-Rats is a major campaign and source information about Paris. We uncover the truth about Cour des Miracles, the underworld of Paris and the myth about the "Lost king".

221534.name: Treasure Deck for 5th Edition: CR 1-4
221534.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

Add exciting loot drops to your CR 1-4 encounters! Each deck has over 200 possible outcomes!

221535.description:
UNRELEASED GAME

221536.description:

221537.name: Treasure Deck for 5th Edition: CR 13-16
221537.description:
UNRELEASED GAME

Publisher's blurb:

221538.name: Treasure Deck for 5th Edition: CR 17-20
221538.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

Add exciting loot drops to your CR 17-20 encounters! Each deck has over 200 possible outcomes!

221539.name: Exiled Kingdoms
221539.description:
Exiled Kingdoms is a single player Action-RPG that allows you to roam freely through a unique world. It is an isometric game, inspired by some of the best role-playing games from the past decades; it brings back the old spirit of the classics in many ways: a challenging environment, choices with consequences, and a solid game system, with different paths to develop your character.

Explore the world: no one will point you to the best hidden secrets. Talk to hundreds of different characters, each with unique dialogues, and solve dozens of quests. Customize your character with dozens of skills and hundreds of different items. Overcome all kind of monsters and antagonists, choosing carefully the weapons or powers for each encounter. And return to the classical dungeon crawl, with traps and secret doors, and death awaiting the unwary adventurer behind every corner.

Source: The Game Website.

221540.name: Dungelot: Shattered Lands
221540.description:
Dungelot: Shattered Lands takes you on an epic roguelike dungeon-crawler adventure to defeat zombie cows, splat giant evil mushrooms, and generally get back home in one piece. Deceptively simple, ever so addictive.

- Three worlds to explore
- 4 Characters to upgrade, each with distinctive play styles
- 18 Dungeons to fight through
- Mini games to uncover, side-quests to undertake
- Bosses to fight, merchants to trade with, and secrets to uncover

Source: The Game Website.

221541.name: Tradewars: Homeworld – Roles Compendium
221541.description:
Description from the publisher:

A "core" set expansion that is designed to primarily alter the turn order of the game. Tired of going around in circles?! This expansion features Premium Role cards that change the turn order. How it works? At the beginning of each round, players secretly choose a Premium Role card. That will be the role they are using on their next turn. Players then simultaneously reveal their role and the order is determined from Highest to Lowest ensuring that the game rounds are always different making each round different.

In addition to the Premium Role cards, also included are two (2) expansion Scenarios: Days of Glory and Battle Front.

As per the original one (1) Player Game Sets, the Days of Glory scenario is back! This scenario brings back the days of early Renaissance and exploration of the Galaxy. In this scenario, players race to be the first player to earn the right to be the Monarch Supreme of the galaxy.

The newer addition to the expansion is the Battle Front scenario. This scenario's goal is to accelerate and shorten the time spent playing the Spacewars scenario. It can be played as a scenario itself OR as another expansion played together with any of the current multiplayer scenarios (Tradewars, Spacewars or Days of Glory). In this scenario, players race to obtain "retrofits" for their starships which will give them bonus effects to alter the way space skirmishes are resolved. There are a total of six (6) different "retrofits" available to each player. Much like the Days of Glory scenario, the retrofits are unlocked as a player earns more credits.

This expansion is comprised of 92 cards for 1 to 4 Players. It can add from 15-30 minutes of additional game time to the "core" game.

221542.description:
Description from the publisher:

A "core" set expansion that is designed to increase the level of strategy by adding Tradeships and Trade Agreements. It features the Mission cards that were removed from the original one (1) Player Box Set due to complexity and an attempt to "streamline" the original game for a wider gamer audience.

Missions are back and therefore so are Tradeships. Tradeships allow you to perform a mission which may take 1 to 5 turns to complete, during this time the player on a mission will benefit from a Trade Agreement which will give them bonus credits when banking certain resources. Modifiers are 2x, +5 and 3x the value of the banked resource (according to the Trade Agreement).

This expansion is comprised of 140 cards for 1 to 4 Players. It also adds 4 white custom dice to be used as counters for Tradeships. It can add from 15-30 minutes of additional game time to the "core" game. However, this is offset by higher banking of resources, which ultimately balances the duration of the game.
221542.name: Tradewars: Homeworld – Planetary Expansion

221543.name: Staxel
221543.description:
User Summary

Grow your own farm, meet the villagers, and join friends online to build your world! Staxel is a multiplayer, farming, sandbox game that is currently in development.

221544.description:
The dragons believed their might was unrivaled. They were mistaken...

DRAGOON: The Rogue and Barbarian Expansion takes the fun and excitement of Dragoon to new heights by increasing the total player count to 6. Rather than adding more playable dragons, you can now test your mettle with two new human roles: the Rogue and Barbarian!

Each character has a unique play style. While the Barbarian plays similarly to the dragons, they require a more tactical approach to increase their strength and gain access to a unique deck of cards. The Rogue relies on stealth and a suite of new equipment to outwit the competition.

With the ability to play using any combination of characters, the first expansion to DRAGOON offers both fresh variants for returning players and the ability to play with a larger group at game night!
221544.name: Dragoon: The Rogue and Barbarian Expansion

221545.name: Fleshscape
221545.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Legends tell of an ancient time, when the world was different. Some say that if one were to dig deep enough, underneath all the flesh and bone and sinew, they would find enigmatic remains of what was before.

But how, and why did things change? No one knows. Some say it was the will of a God; others believe it was the work of the ageless titans known as Dragons. Despite this, it is unclear which one came first: the fleshlands or the dragons themselves. They are without doubt the most powerful beings known, embodying the alien intelligence of the world itself.

A world which is very much alive and tends to behave as a creature, driven by unfathomable logic. The fleshscape is always shifting, following the labyrinthine vision of an alien conscience.

A bizarre, unforgiving ecosystem.

A land of monsters... and a land of humans.

In Fleshscape, you play the role of leading members of a small, primitive nomadic tribe. You journey through the fleshlands seeking knowledge, resources, or simply looking for a relatively safe place to settle in.

Everything you use, wear, or wield comes from the corpse of another creature: you will need to hunt, kill and scavenge in order to survive!

221546.name: Truel
221546.description:
User summary:

Truel (titled Il Triello in the original Italian-language version) is a free-form, live-action roleplaying game set in the fictional town of El Cactus somewhere in the American West.

A few props are needed - four poker cards, a plastic revolver and sheriff's badge, and a cowboy hat.

221548.description:
The Primus GEP was where it all began. A test subject that was developed before the Hikari had set out on their voyage, The Primus acted as the starting genetic code for all of the G.E.P.E.C. programs. It was kept in an unconscious stasis, but since The Fall, massive power fluctuations have left survivors wondering whether The Primus has awoken from its slumber…

The Primus GEP introduces a new boss to Endure the Stars, complete with its own unique Boss deck and mission! The survivors have decided to act quickly and put an end to The Primus before it wakes, but little do they know that it has already woken up!

Pack contents:
Primus card deck - 22 cards
1 Radar token
1 Health token
1 Primus dashboard
1 Primus miniature
221548.name: Endure the Stars: Primus Expansion

221549.name: League of War: Mercenaries
221549.description:
League of War: Mercenaries is an exciting war strategy game where you can make choices that have real impact and outcomes. Immerse yourself in this 3D war game to build your base, grow your army, and battle your way to victory.

3D battlefield mixed with a unique tug of war deck-based combat system, giving you an exciting tactical war strategy game that will keep you playing for days! Build a fighting force of extraordinary magnitude to wage war on corporations and nations. Take on hundreds of missions or compete with fellow Mercenaries to claim victory around the globe and enjoy the spoils of war!

In League of War: Mercenaries, players act as mercenaries, taking on military contractors that play out on the battlefield to claim victory around the globe. Upgrade your army with futuristic tech, battle your enemies, and come out on top in this tactical war.

Source: The Developer Website.

221550.name: League of War
221550.description:
http://league-of-war.wikia.com/wiki/League_of_War_Wiki

League of War was a unit-building, combat-strategy game! Players can create an army to battle across hundreds of Campaign missions, defeat powerful Boss units, and compete against other players!

In late 2016, the game was replaced by it sequel, League of War: Mercenaries.

221551.name: Bounty Bots
221551.description:
Take part in the classic tale of greedy robotic desperados hurling explosive cacti and toxic goo at each other in the historic frontier town of Deadbolt.

Okay, so maybe it’s not so classic, but Bounty Bots is a frantic multiplayer action game with outrageous weapons and zany powers in a West that never was. Bag Bounties, grab coins and GET TO THE BANK to lock in your loot. Customize your ‘bot, choose your weapons, and get rich in the craziest shooter available on mobile devices.

221552.name: My Horse
221552.description:
Live the dream of owning and looking after a realistic horse!

HORSE CARE
Care for your horse by grooming, feeding, and treating it. Build a bond together in a wide range of interactive 3D activities and when you're ready, there are eight different breeds to collect and look after!

COMPETITIONS
Exciting show jumping events are waiting for you! Practice makes perfect as you train to compete in a series of challenging competitions. Keeping your horse happy and healthy is the key to success! Will you reach the World Championships?

AWESOME IN-GAME CAMERA
Take pictures of your horse in action as it plays and eats in the paddock – it’s as if you’re really there!

SOCIAL GAMEPLAY
Help each other out: visit your friends’ stables to look after their horses – many hands make light work!

AMAZING GRAPHICS
My Horse looks amazing. Watch how your horse moves and how its ears tell you its mood. Marvel at the Pinto horses – each one looking unique. Or soak up the atmosphere during a prestigious show jumping competition. My Horse brings you into a world that you won’t want to leave.

Source: The Developer Website.

221553.name: CSR Racing 2
221553.description:
CSR Racing 2 – The next chapter to the #1 drag racing game series of all time has arrived.

Setting a new standard in visuals, CSR2 delivers hyper-real drag racing to the palms of your hands. Compete against live players across the world with your custom built supercars including LaFerrari, McLaren P1™, Koenigsegg One:1 and many more.

Team up with friends to form a crew, tune your rides for maximum speed and dominate the competition in global crew events. CSR2 is all-new; download for free and start racing now!

Source: The Developer Website.

221554.name: CSR Classics
221554.description:
Race the greatest cars ever made, and restore them to their former glory!

A brand new game in the CSR series, CSR Classics sets the benchmark in graphics and gameplay. Get ready to race!

Source: The Developer Website.

221555.name: Clumsy Ninja
221555.description:
Meet Clumsy Ninja, the most hapless ninja ever to grace a touchscreen!

Train him, throw him, tickle him, and even tie balloons to him. Everything you do will make Clumsy Ninja more skilful, and help him find his missing friend, Kira.

Clumsy Ninja is the next generation of interactive characters! He can sense, feel, move, and react uniquely every time. Prepare to be amazed…oh, and please take good care of him!

Source: The Developer Website.

221556.name: Dawn of Titans
videogamehonor: 2017 British Academy Game Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
221556.description:
The BEST graphics on mobile – You’ve never seen a game like this before!

Control COLOSSAL TITANS and THOUSANDS OF WARRIORS in STUNNING 3D wars!

CAPTURE enemy lands, grow your army, and come to fight, because in Dawn of Titans you either GO BIG or you GO HOME!

Join your friends and PLAY FOR FREE! In the most massive ACTION-STRATEGY game on mobile!

Source: The Developer Website.

221557.name: Icebreaker Hockey
221557.description:
NaturalMotion Games, the makers of the million-selling hit Backbreaker Football, are proud to present: ICEBREAKER HOCKEY! Crushing checks, slick moves, and super-addictive gameplay combine to create an experience that redefines action on the rink!

Deke and spin your way towards the goal, dodging and skating past players on a mission to take you down. If you make it through, it’s time to face the GOALTENDER: taunt him with your SHOWBOATING skills, and charge up a SUPER-SHOT to show him who’s boss!

Source: The Developer Website.

221559.name: What the Dickens (Pathfinder)
221559.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Mini-Dungeon adventure for 4 Level 8 PCs

In an incredible piece of opportunistic pilfering an exotic noblewoman (actually a Rakshasa Marais in disguise) was “relieved” of a valuable necklace (actually a Rakshasa Raktavarna in disguise) by a young pick-pocket called Dodger.

When the authorities told the noble “lady” and her “brother”(also a disguised Rakshasa though in this case one of the so called “Common” types) that they would not be able to recover their stolen necklace the two Rakshasas decided to take matters into their own hands by adopting new disguises and then using them to set up a mini Thieves’ Guild in the sewers, one that specialises in helping young pick-pockets with their career aspirations.

The female Rakshasa, the Marais, now disguising herself as “Nancy”, acts like a bawdy cockney gal who enjoys a good drink and a sing-song while she gathers young strays around her with a kind word and a meat pie (since most of them are starving). When she fi nds likely pick-pockets she sends them down for mentoring and protection to her brother “Fagin” who, being the “Common” Rakshasa now disguised as an elderly twisted rogue, looks after his “little wascals” until space in the hideout gets a bit tight and he is forced to send one off for “special training”.

It’s all a bit below the Rakshasas dignity and the Raktavarna would laugh its head off if it ever found out what was happening but in the end it’s the best that they could come up with and when all is said and done they are gradually working their way through the city’s young pick-pocket population. In the meantime the Raktavarna, realising its precarious position, has chosen not to reveal itself to Dodger while it waits for a possible rescue, using instead its Suggestion and Charm Person spells on him while he sleeps in order to prevent itself from being fenced.

221560.name: The World Forge (Pathfinder)
221560.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Mini-Dungeon adventure for 4 level 11 PCs

A powerful planar entity has drafted the PCs to test out alternate versions of cosmology, hoping mortal creativity might accomplish what immortal acumen could not. To succeed in their task the PCs must use this engine of creation to generate a miniature world, then defend that world from a miniature apocalypse.

The World Forge in Your Campaign
Sometimes, heroes must leave the comfortable confines of the dungeon for grander adventures. Rather than saving villages and kingdoms, such powerful PCs must now concern themselves with saving the cosmos. This adventure is a stepping stone between these two power levels, introducing PCs into the larger conflicts of the planes. The entity who created this bizarre engine might be divine, demonic, or utterly alien in nature depending on the needs of your campaign. However, its need for a “replacement world” offers foreshadowing for your choice of apocalyptic threats.

221561.name: I'll Plague Both Your Houses (Pathfinder)
221561.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Mini-Dungeon adventure for 4-6 level 9-10 PCs

The Underworld houses strange and unpleasant communities, and the ruins of two temple complexes are a perfect example of religious hubris coming before a fall. Two traditions devoted to bloody sacrifi ce and unwilling death - one lawful, one chaotic - found this remote cavern an ideal place to practice their beliefs AND constant, petty one-upmanship, far from interfering good-doers. But a malignantly wicked elf, devoid of distraction from his evil intent, played the followers against each other until all were slaughtered. However, he didn’t reckon on some senior members becoming powerful undead intent on wiping him and each other out. He’s now stuck in a “neutral zone”. The PCs walk into this three-way standoff . This encounter is a stiff challenge for the su ggested levels. The party will need to set individuals against others to succeed.

221562.name: The Blight (Pathfinder)
221562.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Mini-Dungeon adventure for 4 Level 3 PCs

For nearly a thousand years this mighty oak stood as monarch of the forest, with its dryad as proud steward. When a self-absorbed druid sought a new home, however, both dryad and tree became ill. This once-comfortable treetop dwelling now lies at the heart of a rotting forest. For even the greatest trees can die, going slowly bad from within.

The Blight in Your Campaign
Capricious fey, druidic circles, and elven kingdoms share something in common: They’re all concerned with the health of their forests. If any of these groups have a place in your world, then The Blight does as well. If the PCs manage to stop the spread of this dangerous fungus, then they will endear themselves to forest guardians of all kinds.

221563.name: Words Fly Up, Thoughts Remain Below
221563.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Mini-Dungeon adventure for 4-6 Level 8-9 PCs

An intellect devourer chanced upon kobold miners tackling a drow anti-paladin. “Contacting” the chieftain, it promised victory through co-operation. Slaying the drow, the devourer took the body and everyone raced to the team’s base. Since then, the devourer’s helped enhance the kobolds, recruited allies, and shaped the rag-tag bunch into a real force. The kobolds trust the devourer, gnome, and wyrmling, but are less certain of the others. “Words fl y up; thoughts remain below,” they say, respecting the abilities of “thems uptheres.” While the lair’s proved impregnable, the devourer’s concerned about future driders, and the kobolds are forever wary; defensive tactics have been executed eff ectively many times. Now it’s less hideout, more a redoubt between chaotic evil denizens below and unsuspecting surfacedwellers.

221565.name: 9 Below
221565.description: Take that game similar to a 3x3 Golf with card interactions.

221568.name: Crawling Under A Broken Moon (Issue 18 - Mar 2017)
rpgissuearticle: The Old Mutant and the Sea
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
221568.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Welcome to the 18th issue of Crawling Under A Broken Moon, a fanzine dedicated to bringing gonzo post apocalyptic content for the Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG from Goodman Games.
This issue contains:

A new Interesting Place to Die: The Menfish Pyramid of the Bass Masters!
The Hybrid, A new alluring character class
New rules for underwater combat
New rules for watercraft creation and combat
And a passel of new amphibious beasties to encounter

For more information, please go to http://crawlingunderabrokenmoon.blogspot.com

221569.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 240 - 2017)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit

221570.name: Judges Guild Journal (Issue 7 - Dec/Jan 1978)
221570.description:
Inside this Issue:
Inn of the Sunken Bridge
Hit Location,
Lycanthropy,
Witchcraft in D&D
The Broken Lance
Heraldry in D&D
Constructing Villages

221571.name: Airport Master
221571.description:
Very detailed game about airport management and aviation in general, including Real World aircraft, procedures, IFR\VFR traffic, ATC, resources, upgrades and sounds! Enjoy the Ultimate Airport Management Experience!

Source: The Developer Website.

221574.name: STOIKHEIA (ストイケイア)
221574.description:
User summary
ストイケイア (STOIKHEIA) is a worker placement card game for two players with extended reproduction mechanism.

In this game, players are wizards who collect elements to create staves which grant you efficiency to collect more elements. But their capacity to store elements is limited, so they should increase the capacity by collecting vials.

Nine action cards are placed on the table in 3 x 3 grid. Each turn, you place your familiar on one of these action cards to perform an action, such as collecting or converting elements, gain victory points, create a staff, etc. When three familiars are placed in a row, you collect a vial and a special effect is activated.

At the end of the game, count victory points earned through taking actions and creating staves. The higher scorer wins the game.

Publisher's summary
「ストイケイア」は２人専用の拡大再生産型ワーカープレイスメントゲームです。
プレイヤーは魔法使いとなり、エレメントを集め、杖を生成します。
杖を生成すれば、１度により多くのエレメントを入手できるようになります。
しかし、持てるエレメントには上限があります。上限を増やすには、瓶を入手しなければなりません。

手番では、３×３に並べられたアクションカードに使い魔コマを置いてアクションを実行します。
使い魔コマを縦か横に３つ揃えると、瓶を入手し、さらに特殊なイベントが発動します。

アクションで得た得点と、杖による得点がより多いプレイヤーの勝利です。

221576.name: Khakun Shrugs
221576.description:
From publisher blurb:

Khakun Shrugs continues our Mythras Monthly Scenarios. February brings you Bruce Turner's adventure, an epic quest to placate an angered god who threatens the resettlement of Further Tarsennia. Who awoke the slumbering Khakun though; and what will be the cost be to avert his wrath? Join the Tarsen initiates of the Ruddy River Association to find out...

221577.name: Mythic Britain: Logres - Lands of the Saxons
221577.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mythic Britain: Logres is Paul Mitchener's superb book detailing the Saxon culture of Britain and contains everything you need to know about these stalwart invaders of the island. Logres details their culture, beliefs, kings and chieftains, politics and superstitions, and presents a mini-campaign set against Cerdic's arrival on the south coast, where he must deal with both belligerent Britons and resentful Saxon settlers alike...

221578.name: Escape From Howling Tower
221578.description:
Do you have what it takes to outlast the Howl of the Tower?

From the introduction:

Legend speaks of a huge tower that rises out of a long desert valley, a tower which is plagued by a howling wind night and day; but the myths also speak of great power in this ancient structure. When heroes find themselves transported to this place, will they have the skill to escape with its treasure - or at least their lives?

User summary:

For 5th - 10th level characters.

221579.name: Giants at the Gate
221579.description:
From the introduction:

In this adventure the PCs need to deal with a tribe of goblins and a giant living in the outer gate fort. The group can be an extension of the force encountered in Leilon 05: The Druid's Grove, or played as a separate adventure by itself.

User summary:

For 5th - 6th level characters.

221580.name: Modernity Character Sheet
221580.description:
From the introduction:

This character sheet is designed for Modernity and has several different modes of use. The primary mode is an interactive character sheet that can be updated in real-time. The secondary mode is as a printed character sheet that can be updated with pencil or pen. Either mode works great for both for character creation and for tracking game activities at the table during play.

221581.name: Pack Attack!
221581.description:
From the introduction:

Gan-Bur is an Ahs settlement on the coast of the Big Water. The Clan has a population of 84, and most members worship the Water Spirit. There are no caves on the coast near Gan-Bur, so the people live in tents, lean-tos, and huts.

221582.name: Towning Around
221582.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Towning around! Towns are the names given to larger settlements in SCRAWL. They are places of business, places of commerce, places where great minds come together to exchange ideas and also places where you can find naked drunks lying in a pool of sick in the streets. Towns are nothing if not diverse.

The populous and vibrant nature of towns means that there are plenty of things to buy and plenty of events going on. There also may be a sinister organisation keeping the populace under the boot heel of oppression. Will some her step up to remove them? Or if not a hero, someone who is greedy and stupid enough to try?

221583.name: Jusenkyo Panic: Race to the Top
221583.description:
An insert game from the December Holiday issue of Animerica Magazine. Volume 2, issue 12. Players race to the finish while trying not to land in a pool or get knocked back by other players. Combat is with cards with the highest tally winning a duel.

From the magazine index.

Now everyone has a chance to get their head wet! You've watched the video and read the comic. ..now it's time to play the board game! A hybrid of popular collectible card games such as
Magic: The Gathering and the children's classic Chutes and Ladders, Jusenkyo Panic: Race to the Top! is a wild ride through some very wet country as you fight (and fight and fight and fight) to reach the infamous Chinese Training Ground of Cursed Springs, Jusenkyo, before it's too late.

221584.name: The Rumble Fish
221584.description:
User Summary
A 2D fighter similar in style to BlazBlue.

221585.name: Heroes of the High Court
221585.description:
(publisher blurb)

Adventure is not limited to forbidding dungeons and grimy back alleys; sometimes the greatest risks and rewards are found in the gleaming halls of queens and emperors. Pathfinder Player Companion: Heroes of the High Court presents everything you need to take your escapades into the royal courts and noble houses of Golarion. Learn how to dress and act in high society, gain access to the echelons of political power, and take advantage of the privileges afforded to those who have mastered the arts of courtly intrigue!

Inside this book, you'll find:

Archetypes for a variety of classes, such as the court fool bard to the butterfly blade slayer, who performs a noble's dirty work in the shadows.
Equipment and magical courtly regalia suitable for any ruler, including thrones that grant great power to whoever earns the right to sit upon them!
New traits, feats, and spells for characters who wish to mingle with nobility, as well as new tactics that let a participant of a verbal duel cut her opponent down to size.

This Pathfinder Player Companion is intended for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and the Pathfinder campaign setting, but can easily be incorporated into any fantasy world.

221586.name: Gloamhold Campaign Guide
221586.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Glowering amid dark rumours and terrible stories of desperate adventure, death, betrayal and glimmering treasures squat the unutterably ancient halls of Gloamhold. This crumbling, benighted, haunted dungeon complex of unknown, but undeniably vast, extent is buried deep within the grim and brooding spray-drenched headland of the Mottled Spire. It is a place of legends, madness and death. Within this towering, wave-lashed shard of limestone lies the labyrinthine passageways and chambers of Gloamhold’s outer reaches and, beyond them, the benighted precincts and canals of the legend-shrouded Twilight City.

Gloamhold is designed for use with any edition of the world’s most popular role-playing game.

221587.name: The Real Deal
221587.description:
From the introduction:

I like Tabletop Role-Playing Games. To me, the best Tabletop RPGs are the ones that emulate the game we all played as kids, "Let’s Pretend." There were few, if any, rules, and what rules there were only made the game more adaptable, more free-form, more intuitive. I feel like we’d hit the Holy Grail of role-playing back then, and RPGs should strive to capture that magic again.

I also like Poker. It’s fun.

As I read through game manuals, I started thinking about an RPG that would use Poker rules instead of dice or charts; I couldn’t find anything like that, so... I made one. And here we are.

221588.name: Pulp! Kharma
221588.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Pulp! Kharma is a light set of [variant] rules from Pulp! the RPG. Create your characters in a few minutes on an index card. Play any genre you like.

User summary:

Pulp! Kharma is a fan-created variant rules set intended to allow easier gamer modification to the basic game.

221589.name: Seals of Sleep
221589.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every Lots of Horror offering provides an item lot presented as though part of an auction. This is an easy way to introduce the item into your game: someone bought the item and now all hell is breaking loose!

This release includes the Seals of Sleep. Although this chained relic seems to grant its bearer courage and a stronger will against external control, it also makes one more vulnerable to insanity. Just what were the Seals of Sleep intended to enclose and contain, and what will people be willing to do to get their hands on them?

221590.name: The Crystal Coffins
221590.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Swords & Wizardry Mini-Dungeon
For 4-6 Adventurers of Levels 5-7

The ghost of a necromancer is raising an army of undead. He can only be stopped by destroying his earthly remains, hidden in a crypt guarded by eight crystal coffins. Unfortunately, the coffins are guarded as well...

The Crystal Coffins is part of a series of mini-dungeons designed to drop into existing adventures or campaigns. Use them as side quests or a way of getting in a quick adventure when you’re short on time.

221591.name: Redemption
221591.description:
From publisher blurb:

1 on 1 Adventures #18: Redemption is a Pathfinder adventure designed for one GM and one player.

For many generations following Halueth Aridryll’s death, his keep remained abandoned, preserved from ruin by ancient elven magic. From time to time the children’s children of the tragic lovers sought to claim the keep for their own. Such efforts invariably failed, and the line of Aridryll faded into obscurity. But now, destiny awaits! Castle Aridryll, the forgotten keep in a hidden valley extends its curse over all who enter its domain. The last heir of the line of Aridryll represents the final hope of salvation for the keep and its builder, a fallen elven paladin whose soul burns in eternal torment.

221592.name: The Gloom Over Dunnocksdell
221592.description:
From publisher blurb:

1 on 1 Adventures 1 on 1 Adventures #20: The Tomb of Kara-Duir is a Pathfinder adventure designed for one GM and one player.

The recent attacks have shocked Dunnocksdell! Tormented by the thought that some of their loved ones are in the grasp of foul magic, the villagers wanted to go looking into the woods for those still missing, but were afraid to leave their homes undefended, and were terrified of what they might run into. They could only guess at the source of the enchantment and found no way to undo it. Will you heed the call of the desperate in Dunnockdell?

221593.name: One Page Dungeon Contest 2010
221593.description:
User summary:

This document contains all of the entries into the One Page Dungeon Contest 2010. Note the winning entries were previously published in a separate document (and are included here as well).

The credits noted here are taken from the pages of the submitted dungeons. While most submissions probably were written and drawn by the same person, only artists specifically noted are credited here.

221594.name: Cash me outside
221594.description:
User Summary

Action game based on the character from Dr. Phil show.

221595.name: Freeport Bestiary
221595.description:
(publisher blurb)

The world of Freeport is a perilous one, as any swab can attest. Sailors face monsters like ocean wyrms and sail dragons, explorers must deal with ghost eaters and harpoon crabs, and city dwellers may be surprised by burnlings and flayed men. You’ll find all these creatures and many more in the Freeport Bestiary for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game!

This 180-page full color sourcebook includes a wide variety of threats, from classic Freeport adversaries like serpentmen and fire spectres to new monsters like corsair drakes and witch beasts. It’s the perfect complement to Freeport: The City of Adventure and can be used to add spice to any Pathfinder Roleplaying Game campaign.

221596.name: Schoolgirl RPG: Complete Edition
221596.description:
(publisher blurb)

School is in session!

You’re a perfectly ordinary schoolgirl at Sakuraba High. Well, ordinary apart from being a cyborg. And a catgirl. And insisting on carrying your Pyonkichi-san plush with you everywhere. Your best friend is normal too though. Apart from being a demon with an overactive imagination of course. You were having a pretty typical day at school. You know, a ninja attack during homeroom, then you found a secret treasure, then Freddie Mercury stopped by the school. Normal stuff.

Schoolgirl RPG is a random comedy RPG about Japanese schoolgirls, based on the rules of Maid: The Role-Playing Game. To play you’ll need some paper, six-sided dice, and friends.

This Complete Edition has the core rules and all three Schoolgirl RPG supplements between two covers. There are bonus character options for schoolgirls, additional random event tables, a random objects, random items, rules for rolling up teacher characters, and even the Otoko no Michi rules for playing schoolBOYS (albeit mostly delinquents). Hours of random weirdness await you for a modest price!

221597.name: One Page Dungeon Contest 2011
221597.description:
User summary:

This document contains all of the entries into the One Page Dungeon Contest 2011. Note the winning entries were previously published in a separate document (and are included here as well).

The credits noted here are taken from the pages of the submitted dungeons. While most submissions probably were written and drawn by the same person, only artists specifically noted are credited here.

221598.name: Magical Fury
221598.description:
(publisher blurb)

Magical Fury is a dark magical girl RPG, inspired by anime series like Madoka Magica, Sailor Moon, and Magical Girl Lyrical Nanoha. Your characters start out as normal girls who discover that they are reincarnated magical girls. They awaken to their powers under fire, and it will be up to you to decide where she goes with new her life from there.

The game uses a very simple variant of the Apocalypse World engine, aimed at fast and flavorful play that you can jump into on short notice or play in a more deliberate, long-term style. Battles come down to a handful of rolls, and throughout the emphasis is decidedly on the consequences of the course of action you choose.

The book also includes an appendix with 17 random tables to help you along with character creation and other things that pop up during play.

To play you will need some six-sided dice, character sheets, and something to write with.

221599.name: Tiny Ninjas
221599.description:
Description from the designer:

Tiny Ninjas is an EPIC 2-player 'Take That' battle card game. It's aimed for players aged 10+ and duels last around 15 minutes each. It has very simple mechanics and is a perfect light strategy game that can be played by anyone and anywhere!

THEME - Battle for victory in action-packed ninja combat. 16 different Ninja characters all with their own unique skills and abilities.

GAMEPLAY - Players take turns attacking and defending each other with a wide cast of ninja characters. Each turn has an attacker and defender. The attacker will play one card from their hand, and if attacking, the defender has a chance to defend the attack with one of their own cards.
The attacker may play as many cards from their hand as they wish (one at a time) however, once they deem their turn over the will only have whatever cards are left over in their hand to defend with in the next turn.
At the end of the Attackers turn, the Defender draws cards until they have a full hand of 5 and then the Defender becomes the Attacker and Attacker becomes Defender. The battle operates like this, back and forth, and whoever reaches zero health first, loses. Players each start with 10 Health points that are tracked via 'health dice'. The game operates with just a deck of 50 cards and 2 dice. It's easy to learn, immensely portable and has fantastic replayability. Every battle is unique and drenched with excitement!

NINJAS - There are two types of Ninjas... Battle and Special. BATTLE Ninjas are usable during either an attack and defend turn. While SPECIAL Ninjas are only usable during the attack turn.

DAMAGE - There are two main types of damage. Strike Damage and Spell Damage. The only difference is that Spell Damage is a bit more uncommon, therefore slightly harder to defend against.
Damage can only be defended by similar damage type. ie. Strike defends Strike, Spell defends Spell... but they cannot defend against each other. However, there are also some ninjas that have SHIELD defend, which can defend both strike and spell.

221600.name: Summoners War (2014)
221600.description:
An action-packed fantasy RPG with over 70 million Summoners around the world! Jump into the Sky Arena, a world under battle over the vital resource: Mana Crystals! Summon over 1000 different types of monsters to compete for victory in the Sky Arena!

Source: The Developer Website.

221601.name: Boku no Natsuyasumi 2
221601.description:
User Summary
You play a boy on his Summer Vacation exploring a coastal Japanese village.

221602.name: Ougon Kishi Garo
221602.description:
User Summary

A hack and slash game based on the Japanese TV show Golden Knight Garo.

221603.name: Westbound
221603.description:
Your wagon has broken down on its quest to Oregon! Now you're stranded in an uncharted canyon with a motley crew of settlers.Pioneer, it's time to build a civilization in this uncharted Oregon frontier and turn it into your own thriving boomtown! Saddle up your horse and come along!

Source: The Developer Website.

221604.name: Westbound: Gold Rush
221604.description:
On your way to the west in search of gold, your wagon breaks down! Now you're stuck in a hidden valley with a bunch of intriguing settlers.Don't fret! Build a great boomtown and explore the beautiful countryside. Saddle up your horse and come along!

Source: The Developer Website.

221605.name: Least I Could Do: The Card Game – Sloppy Seconds
221605.description:
You've played the men, you've played the ladies, now it's time to play the rest. Brave the bars after the gold's been mined and see if you can find a diamond in the rough. Just beware, you might have to get freaky to get their attention.

Fully compatible with the original Least I Could Do: The Card Game, and the Ladies Night! Expansion, Sloppy Seconds lets you play characters like Harry the Homeless Guy and Mick's Mom trying to pick up miscellaneous dates like Llama and the Suck For A Buck girl, using actions like Golden Shower, Movember, and a surprising number of pandas.

221606.name: Hokuto no Ken (2005)
221606.description:
User Summary
A 2D fighter similar in style to Guilty Gear series. Based on the manga Fist of the North Star.

221607.name: Epic Battle Fantasy
221607.description:
User Summary

Select commands from the menus and make the enemies die.
Battle through waves of enemies without stopping.

221608.name: Epic Battle Fantasy 2
221608.description:
User Summary

Battle waves of monsters again!
Now with upgrades!

221609.name: Chrono Bomb
221609.description:
Mission: Cross The Laser Field Before It's Too Late!

Chrono Bomb is a super secret spy game where kids use the included clamps and 27.5-ft. string to create a “laser” field to crawl through. At the end of the maze is the bomb, counting down…tick, tick, tick! So, you have to hurry, carefully, and make it to the end to defuse the bomb and be the hero! Play over and over again, building new courses each time or trying to beat your or your friend’s time! Includes free app for more play value!

221617.name: Ascension Isle & Highport: City of Airship Pirates
221617.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

This issue of Cartographer’s Cache includes various map versions of the floating island called Ascension and its lone settlement, Highport — city of airship pirates. Versions of the included are labeled and unlabeled for both daytime and nighttime (perfect for virtual tabletop gaming).

This issue's PDF is distributed in a ZIP file due to the included layered TIF graphic file which allows the floating island to be rotated, repositioned, or pasted over a different "ground" map.

Be sure to check back here each month for brand new cartography.

221618.name: Vampire
221618.description:
From cassette back
TO DESTROY VAMPIRE Travel through Dracula's castle of 95 eerie rooms collecting food as your energy is drained by his evil friends.

To destroy Count Dracula you must first find the five keys and fit them into their fice locks (inversed keys). To retrieve one of the kes and object must be found to fix the pedal powered generator enabling you to leap the vast chasm.

You must also open the six magical shutters by tripping the appropriate switches.

Then collect the hammer and stake and go to the top of the castle to get the cross. Now you will be teleported to deep-space for your final confrontation using laser bolts and jet-pack thrusters!!

221619.name: Agaricath Drow Slave Mine
221619.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Agaricath: Drow Slave Mine

Deep beneath the earth, hundreds of slaves work in the diabolical mines of the Drow, working endlessly, knowing they will never see sunlight again!
A printable rpg battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl or skirmish game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset. The map is 50x50, equivalent to 25 of our standard 10x10 tiles.

Contents: A huge subterranean mine complex. The entrance consists of loading areas, mine carts and guard rooms. One passage leads to the supervisors office and quarters, as well as the barracks for the Drow guards. The other passage leads to the large cavern where slaves are kept in rough cells. The main part of the mine has tunnels, wooden platforms for mining the cavern face, and tracks for removing the ore. Beyond the mines are the caverns of the Underdark, filled with strange fungi and dangerous creatures.

Download includes:
250dpi A4 pdf, with gridded map spread across 50 pages for easy printing.
250dpi A4 pdf, with gridless map spread across 50 pages for easy printing.
250dpi full jpeg versions for VTT or poster printing (gridded and gridless)
Note: Whilst the download looks large, it consists of several separate files - just download the versions you need.

A note on VTT use - we have deliberately kept the quality of the file high, and you may need to resize the jpeg for use in your VTT software. Keeping the file size and resolution high gives you the flexibility to use the map how you want - crop out a particular section or use the entire map, the choice is yours.

221620.name: Quattro Adventure (1990)
221620.description:
User Summary
A collection of four adventure games previously published by Codemaster.

With Dizzy[/thing] and Vampire[/thing] on one side, and with Ghost Hunters[/thing] and Super Robin Hood[/thing] on the other side.

221621.name: Somorrah in Soulrest
221621.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

In the Cypher System's Gods of the Fall fantasy game, Somorrah is a nexus of physical light and dark while being a bastion of freedom and relative safety.

In the land of the dead called Soulrest, the city is a twisted mirror where one wrong step can lose a soul their free will.

Discover the city anew ... from a different point of view.

New monsters like the Neveri Pod or the Dylph.
New locations and NPCs
A GotF vignette

All crammed into 13 beautiful pages. You'll need both the Cypher System Rulebook and the Gods of the Fall to play.

Ganza Gaming strikes again!

221622.name: Doraken
221622.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Now you can play and use the same D&D 5e campaign setting as the one featured in the Denglish (ie Danish/English) Doraken Podcast ( https://soundcloud.com/user-823986121 ).

The PDF includes the map of the three of continents known as Trinevalt, four homebrew races (hagspawn, jotun, lukan, and wilden), a general overview of Trinevalt's history, a list of deities, important NPCs, major events, and a list of optional Magic Marks.

221623.name: Seed of Doubt
221623.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

A simple, easy job. Easy work for good pay and free ship upgrades to boot. Far be it for your ship to profit from the misfortunes of others, but this is business. This is almost too good to be true.

Seed of Doubt is a fast, easily run adventure for a crew of a small ship, perfect for Travellers just starting their careers in Space.

221624.name: Vulcan Class Logistical Production Unit
221624.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The Vulcan Class ship is a mobile asteroid processing and production unit. This allows the production of higher technology products in lower technology sectors. The military can use this technology to create a mobile production system to support their logistical supply chain.

221625.name: Raiders
221625.description:
Raiders is a game of surviving and gathering resources in order to gain supremacy within a post apocalyptic world of ruin. Each player takes on the role of a Clan who have been surviving within the wastes for the past four years. When a Death Cult set upon eradicating all remaining life within the wastes descend upon the Clans’ homeland, they must gather all the resources they can in order to survive.

The aim of Raiders is to be the last player in the game, or have earned the most points by the end of the tenth turn.
Each Player’s Clan has their own base that they are trying to protect and grow by gathering more resources. Players develop these bases by sending their Raiders to the 11 different locations that represent the wastes. The locations each player’s Raiders are going to that turn are all revealed at the same time, meaning encounters between Raiders are always a surprise. At the end of each phase, those Raiders who survive are able to return to their base with the spoils they have recovered. Players then use the resources they have obtained to build new items upon their base that improve their performance in the rest of the game.

During encounters between Raiders, there are specific rules for Raiders to negotiate rather than simply battling each time. However if players are unable or unwilling to negotiate with one another, a round of combat can quickly break out. Combat rounds are fast paced and easy to follow so as not to overtake the gathering element of the game.

Not simply content with scrounging the wastes for more resources, Raiders can attack enemy bases in an attempt to wipe enemy factions out and gather more resources from their ruins. Each side must therefore be vigilant or risk losing all that they have amassed.

221626.name: Mont-à-Mots Gribouillis
boardgameversion: Mont-à-Mots Gribouillis, Ludik Québec - French First Edition
221626.description:
Mont-à-mots Gribouillis est un jeu de dessin où petits et grands doivent faire preuve de dextérité.

Fais tourner le crayon de la roulette et laisse le sort décider de ce que tu devras dessiner : un objet, un personnage ou le contenu d’une carte « Défi surprise ». Dessiner les yeux fermés ou avec ta main la moins habile ou sans lever le crayon sont au nombre des défis à relever. Et sois sans crainte, des cartes de jeu s’adressent aussi aux débutants.

Mont-à-mots Gribouillis is a dexterity drawing game for all ages.

You turn the "Pencil Roulette" and it will give you the type of drawing you will have to do : an object, a character or follow the directions on the "surprise challenge" card. Drawing with your eyes closed or with your non-dominant hand or without lifting the pencil are among the challenges you will have to face. And for the youngsters there's also a set of special cards just for them.

221627.name: Banana Bugs
221627.description:
Hordes of banana-hungry bugs are ravaging the village food supply and you’re the only monkey brave enough to take them on! Shoot ropes to wall off bugs and stop them in their tracks.

Source: The Publisher Website.

221628.name: Slaughterball: The Quad Arena
221628.description: A Slaughterball arena for 2-player only games.

221629.name: Greenscape
221629.description:
From the back of the book:

Durante demasiado tiempo, la humanidad utilizó la naturaleza pensando solo en sus propios fines. Hoy, Big Mamma se ha despertado y está muy, muy enfadada.
¡Bienvenidos al universo greenpunk! En el futuro, la civilización humana fue destruida casi por completo y, esta vez, nosotros somos la presa. Pero aún queda esperanza. Unos pocos valientes han estudiado las cintas kodakianas del pasado, han comprendido las enseñanzas de la naturaleza o, simplemente, pretenden sobrevivir en un mundo tan verde y hostil como jamás hayas podido imaginar.
¿Te atreverás a unirte a ellos?

221630.name: Republica de Bananes
221630.description:
Republica de Bananes is a 3-8 player free-for-all card game, set in a banana republic during the height of the Cold War. Players take on the role of the county’s ruling politicians. Their goal is to achieve a secret Ulterior Motive, while stopping their opponents achieving their own, all while trying to rule the country.

Ulterior Motives include seizing the presidency with the support of a paricular faction, embezzling the nation's budget, manipulating the nation into becoming an outpost of the US or USSR, or causing outright civil war and benefiting from the ensuing chaos.

During a turn each player takes four actions, using cards drawn from the Power deck, and other options based on the political landscape of the nation, such as its current Stability, and the levels of foreign influence. These actions include playing Supporter cards to increase their personal strength, and activating abilities, which can improve their position or hinder an opponent. Some abilities have broader effects, changing the political climate for all players.

Elections and Coups are a key part of the game. Each turn players jockey for political power, and often must rely on the support of their rivals to gain the power they seek. After negotiations are done players reveal their choices simultaneously. This is often accompanied by a fanfare of cheers, laughs, and cries of anguish from the betrayed.

221631.name: Lucid: Morpheus Edition
221631.description:
Publisher Blurb

Lucid is a card game where players battle the night using their dreams against the nightmares of their opponents to be the last asleep.

Lucid is a deck of Tarot-sized cards, where players battle the night using their dreams against the nightmares of their opponents to be the last dreamer asleep.

But...

Lucid combines the elements of fast-paced game-play, stunning art, and subtle strategies into a competitive experience unlike anything else. It can be learned in one game and you can be stabbing your friends in the back like a master, by your third. But in the end, the dice decide your fate.

221632.name: Bonnie's Bookstore
221632.description:
Link letters to form words in this exciting new word puzzle game! Bonnie has been running her bookstore for a while – now she wants to write her own books...

Help her write updated, best-selling versions of classic children’s tales by spelling words on the 50 unique levels. Pick up Wildcards and special bonus letters to spell extra-long words – but watch out for Writer’s Blocks – they’ll put your puzzle solving skills to the test!

Features:

50 challenging puzzles, 3 difficulty levels
Classic mode for easy-going fun, or Action mode for a speed challenge
Wildcards, Writer's Blocks, Locked tiles, and six other special tiles and letters

Source: The Publisher Website.

221633.name: Mascletà
221633.description:
Mascletas are a tradition from the city of Valencia, Spain, where the city pyrotechnics organise the most complex and daring fireworks displays.

The deck of cards is divided in Petardos (BOOM!), Carcasas (PAMM) and Salidas (FIUUU), besides of the special cards. The pyrotechnic (one of the players) shuffles the cards and puts them on the table. In turns, the players will turn the cards on the table to reveal the Petardo, Carcasas o Salidas. Every time a card is turned up, the player will say the sounds corresponding to the illustration on the card and repeat the sound of all the cards that have been turned up previously. When a player mistakes the sound or doesn’t remember the sequence they lose a life. The player who lost the life starts the next round. (Note: players can’t use fingers to count).

The winner will be the player who has more lifes when one of the other players loses all of their lifes. In case of a draw, it would be a mascletà to break the draw.

There are some special cards.

221634.name: Fullmetal President: White House Mecha Chaos
rpg: Fullmetal President: White House Mecha Chaos
221634.description:
(publisher blurb)

Fullmetal President is an RPG of fast and furious mecha action. Roll some dice, narrate some explosions, and restore Freedom to America! The PDF includes the usual RPG stuff, plus a full description of the presidential succession (the First Children share a spot near the end of the list, but only if they finish their homework), ideas for scenes, and ideas for sequels if you want to play again once you've defeated Nathan Wolf, including Fullmetal President vs. Fullmetal Prime Minister and Fullmetal President vs. Zombie Cyborg Theodore Roosevelt.

221635.name: Cerii Ously, Halfling Daredevil
221635.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the first (of many hopefully)single character codices based on a particular character concept. In this issue we introduce Cerii Ously, a halfling bard (daredevil) that becomes entrenched in the world of fantasy espionage. Presented are six versions of Cerii, starting as a 1st level neophyte bard. She is then presented at 4th level and every four levels thereafter through 20th level. Each iteration includes a brief of her abilities and mindset, possible character interaction ideas, and possible boons she may provide to the player-characters.

The builds include a normal 15 point buy for her normal ability scores and a heroic block that includes a 20 point upgrade to her ability scores as well as an upgrade in equipment. A new magic item is also presented, an item used by our famous bard.

221636.name: Melancholy Kaiju
221636.description:
(publisher blurb)

Melancholy Kaiju is a role-playing game where you and some friends make up stories about cute giant monsters living ordinary lives and being kind of sad.

It has six sample kaiju (The Amazing Colossal Office Lady, Beatzilla, Hole Punch Man, King Emo, MUKO, and Parfaitrah), rules an optional tables for making your own kaiju, rules for playing the game, and a table of ideas for scenes.

221637.name: Saving Throw
221637.description:
(publisher blurb)
